title: Exercising Your Way to a Fitter You: Walk or Run - Which is Best For You?
summary: Walking is an aerobic activity, which means it helps your heart and lungs work better. It also increases your metabolism, helping you burn more calories throughout the day. Walking boosts mental health by reducing stress, anxiety, and depression. Running is a high-impact activity, so it may be a better choice for those who are new to exercise. The amount of running you should do depends on your fitness level and goals. If you want to lose weight, youâ€™ll need to do more than one session per week.

intro.compiledSource: const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...o}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...o,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,"In today\u2019s fast-paced world, we have less time to work out and still keep up with all our responsibilities. But with the right plan, anyone can make time for exercise. The question is: What type of exercise should you focus on to get the best results in the shortest amount of time? Walking or running may seem like two very different exercises, but when it comes to burning fat and calories, your body responds in similar ways no matter which one you choose. In this article, we\u2019ll discuss the benefits of each one and which is best for you based on your personal fitness level. Keep reading to discover more!"))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

content.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...n}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...n,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("h2",null,"The benefits of walking"),mdx("p",null,"Walking is a great way to get active and stay fit. It\u2019s one of the most accessible forms of exercise; you can do it pretty much anywhere and at any time. You can walk indoors or outdoors, on a treadmill, while listening to music, with a friend, or with your family. Walking is an aerobic activity, which means it helps your heart and lungs work better. It also increases your metabolism, helping you burn more calories throughout the day."),mdx("p",null,"Walkers can reduce their risk of heart disease, diabetes, obesity, and certain types of cancer. Walking boosts mental health by reducing stress, anxiety, and depression. It also promotes better sleep, which is essential for a healthy immune system."),mdx("h2",null,"The benefits of running"),mdx("p",null,"Like walking, running is another aerobic exercise that can help you burn more calories, improve your heart and lung health, reduce stress, and improve your sleep. Running is a high-impact activity, so it may be a better choice for those who are new to exercise. You may have heard that running is better than walking for weight loss, but in truth, you can get pretty much the same benefits from either one. The real difference between the two is that running is more intense and requires more effort. This can be helpful if you\u2019re trying to challenge yourself with a high-intensity workout. But if you\u2019re just starting out (or even if you\u2019re a veteran runner), high-intensity workouts can cause injury. That\u2019s why it\u2019s important to start out slow and build up your endurance."),mdx("h2",null,"How much running is enough?"),mdx("p",null,"The amount of running you should do depends on your fitness level and goals. If you want to improve your health and fitness, you can start with one-minute intervals alternating with one-minute rest intervals. As you get fitter, you can increase the length of the intervals. Moderate runners can build up to 30 minutes per session, while serious runners can increase their time to an hour or more."),mdx("p",null,`If you\u2019re training for an event like a marathon, you\u2019ll need to do even more running, with more intensity and fewer breaks. One running session per week may be enough for many people, but two or three sessions per week may be better for others.
If you want to lose weight, you\u2019ll need to do more than one session per week.`),mdx("h2",null,"The benefits of walking and running together"),mdx("p",null,"Walking and running aren\u2019t completely different exercises. They use many of the same muscles and set off the same metabolic reactions in the body. So if you\u2019re alternating between the two, you may get more benefits than if you were doing just one or the other. For example, combining walking and running can help you improve your aerobic fitness faster. You may also see faster improvements in your body weight, body shape, and body composition."),mdx("p",null,"Because walking and running are both aerobic activities, they work together to increase your metabolism. When you walk or run, your body burns fat as its main source of energy. As you walk or run more often, you\u2019ll increase your metabolism and have more energy throughout the day."),mdx("h2",null,"Should you walk or run?"),mdx("p",null,"You can walk or run to get fit, but walking and running together will provide more benefits than just one or the other. And as we said above, walking and running can help you improve your aerobic fitness faster than doing just one or the other alone. Plus, you\u2019ll also get some strength training benefits, as well."),mdx("p",null,"Generally, walkers burn more calories per hour than runners do. But runners will burn more calories overall because they\u2019re getting more exercise during their leisure time than walkers do during the same amount of time."),mdx("p",null,"That said, if you\u2019re trying to lose weight, running may be better for you than walking. That\u2019s because there are no calories in running, whereas walking burns fewer calories than running. The more intense running session may also help you work off a few extra pounds."),mdx("h2",null,"Run for weight loss, walk for fitness"),mdx("p",null,"As we\u2019ve seen above, walking and running together can help you get fit and lose weight. But it\u2019s important to note that walking is a moderate-intensity exercise while running is high intensity. While both forms of exercise can help you lose weight, they may have different effects on other health aspects of your body. Moderate exercise like walking is associated with better mental health than high-intensity exercise like running, for example."),mdx("p",null,"So if you\u2019re hoping to improve your mental health and mood, walking may be a better choice for you. And if you\u2019re hoping to get fitter and lose weight, running may be the better option for you."),mdx("p",null,"In general, walking and running can provide many of the same benefits. But walking may be a better choice for people who want to improve their mental health, while running may be a better choice for people who want to lose weight."),mdx("h2",null,"Final words"),mdx("p",null,"Walking and running are great ways to get more active, improve your health, and lose weight. All you have to do is get out there and start moving! Whether you\u2019re a beginner or higher level exerciser, walking or running can help you stay fit."),mdx("p",null,"You can choose which activity is best for you based on your fitness level, goals, and availability. Whether you\u2019re hoping to improve your mental health, lose weight, or get fitter, walking or running is a great way to get there."))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: 10 Tips for Staying Motivated to Eat Healthy

intro.compiledSource: const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:t,...e}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...e,components:t,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,"Are you struggling to stay motivated to eat healthy? In our fast-paced world, it can be challenging to stick with a diet or eating plan. It\u2019t not easy staying motivated and sticking with a diet when there are so many temptations around us. Eating the right foods is important for our long-term health. There are so many benefits of eating healthy foods and it may help you feel better, have more energy, and even live longer. However, many people find it difficult to maintain their eating habits because their life is full of distractions like work, school, and family obligations. Staying motivated takes time and effort but it\u2019t possible if you don\u2019t make small changes in your daily routine that support your goals. Here are"))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: The Benefits of a Plant-Based Diet

intro.compiledSource: const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...o}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...o,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,"You\u2019ve probably heard it before: When you\u2019re busy, you need healthy snacks to keep you going. The problem is that it\u2019s not always easy to find healthy snacks that are also fast and convenient. In our hectic, on-the-go world, most of us don\u2019t have time to sit down for a healthy meal three times a day. Instead, we\u2019re often forced to make snap decisions about what we can eat quickly and conveniently. Unfortunately, those decisions too often lead to less than healthy snack options like potato chips or sweets. However, there are plenty of great ways to get your recommended daily intake of fruits and veggies even when you\u2019re on the go. These 30 healthy snacks for on-the-go are perfect for keeping in your purse, desk drawer, locker, or anywhere else you might find yourself hungry and without access to a full meal."))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: How to Make Healthy Snacks More Exciting
How to Cook Healthier Meals at Home

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Getting a healthy meal at home can be challenging, especially with busy schedules and tight budgets. But you don\u2019t have to sacrifice your health to save money or reduce time spent in the kitchen.
A nutritious diet doesn\u2019t have to be expensive or time-consuming. With some planning and preparation, you can make home-cooked meals that are both cheap and healthy. Healthy eating is more than just counting calories; it\u2019s about focusing on foods that are unprocessed and rich in vitamins, minerals, and other nutrients. Eating well helps keep you lean, boost your immune system, manage your weight, and prevent chronic diseases like heart disease and type 2 diabetes. Focusing on the right foods will help get you there. Let\u2019s take a look at some tips on how to cook healthier meals at home!`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: 10 Exercises You Can Do at Home and save a Ton of Money

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...o}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...o,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Who says working out has to be expensive? You can do it anywhere and anytime. There are various affordable home workout videos available on the internet as well. However, that doesn\u2019t mean you have to break the bank when trying to save money in other areas of your life. Those at-home videos might seem like your only cheap option, but there are plenty of ways you can cut down on costs while still getting the same benefits from working out at home.
Instead of splurging on a one-time membership or an expensive series of DVDs, why not invest in some home equipment that won\u2019t cost you a fortune, but will help you get in great shape? Working out at home also has its advantages: no traffic jams and no gym membership fees! Here are 10 cheap home workout ideas for anyone who wants to slim down and tone up without breaking their budget.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

7 Tips to Keep You Motivated When Working Out
The Benefits of Regular Exercise - And How to Get Started

intro.compiledSource: const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,"Getting into a regular workout routine is something that\u2019s a lot easier said than done for most people. While some of us have it easier than others when it comes to fitting fitness into our busy lives, we all struggle with different things at one point or another. It\u2019s easy to let other responsibilities fall by the wayside and not get moving, so you need to be strategic about how and when you work out. While there are many different benefits to exercise, the biggest thing that it has to offer is stress reduction. If you\u2019re looking for ways to reduce your stress in your everyday life, adding exercise to your routine is a great place to start. Here are some reasons why getting your sweat on regularly could be exactly what you need right now:"))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;
